byline.contributor: Serge F. Kovaleski contributed reporting. Susan Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and SYDNEY EMBER

abstract: Legal and publicity advisers for Bill Cosby remain quiet after newly released 2005 court record shows that he had admitted to obtaining Quaaludes in 1970s to give to young women with whom he wanted to have sex.
lead_paragraph: Since a court record showed that Mr. Cosby had admitted obtaining Quaaludes to give to young women with whom he wanted to have sex, his formerly aggressive team has gone quiet.

headline.main: Cosby Legal and Publicity Teams Opt for Silence After Admission Is Released
headline.print_headline: Cosby Legal and Publicity Teams Opt for Silence After Admission Is Released

snippet: Since a court record showed that Mr. Cosby had admitted obtaining Quaaludes to give to young women with whom he wanted to have sex, his formerly aggressive team has gone quiet.
